title: O That I Knew the Secret Place
lyrics:
O that I knew
The secret place,
Where I might find my God,
I'd spread my wants
Before His face,
And pour my woes abroad.

I'd tell Him
How my sins arise,
What sorrows I sustain,
How grace decays,
And comfort dies
And leaves my heart in pain.

He knows what arguments
I'd take,
To wrestle with my God,
I'd plead for His
Own mercy's sake,
And for my Saviour's blood.

My God will pity
My complaints,
And heal my broken bones,
He takes the meaning
Of His Saints,
The language of their groans.

Arise, my soul,
From deep distress,
And banish every fear,
He calls Thee to
His throne of grace,
To spread thy sorrows there.
